yang ba rong ston pa bya ba la sras shig yod pa sras de cher ma song bar yab grong / sras de la yum gyis ri la shing bag re thur bcug pas / nyin gcig yum gyis thag pa dang zan mar rdog po gcig bskur nas zla bo 'ga' zhig dang 'grogs nas shing bsgrub pa la btang bas / lam du zla bo rnams song / kho 'gro ma 'dod nas sa gcig tu gnyid log pa'i rmi lam du mi zhig gi / khyod ma smad sdug ma sems shig / da ste lo gcig gnyis na dngos grub cig 'ong gi zer ro / gnyid sad nas bltas pas mi de mig snga na wa ler 'dug /

(Concerning the life-story of the text-discoverer, sGom-chen gYung-drung-grags) Ba-rong sTon-pa had a son whose father died before he grew up. His mother let him collect firewood in the mountains. One day his mother, giving him a rope and some food, sent him with some friends to collect firewood (to a distant place). On the way all his friends went on ahead, but he did not feel like going with them and went to sleep by the way. In his dream a man said to him: «You and your mother need not feel sorrow. A gift will come to you in one or two years’ time.» When he woke up he (still) could see the man clearly in front of him.

yang gnyid log nas bsdad pas zag med kyi bde ba rgyud la skyes so / yang re zhig kho'i rmi lam du bya chen po nam mkha' khebs pa tsam gyi spyi gtsug tu / shel gyi khye'u tshon gang ba zhig gi ngag tu / a dkar sa le 'od brjod pa zhig rmis / gnyid sad pa dang khos kyang 'ga' re bzlas pas rig pa gzhi thog tu gnas pa byung / de nas rgyun du bzlas pas lta ba nam mkha' lta bu rgyud la skyes te / phyis dus su ba rang sgom chen g.yung drung grags bya ba byung ngo / de nyid kyis sta sgo gangs nas nang dmar tshogs kyi bon / drang mkhan lha dkar gyi bon la sogs phyi nang gsang ba'i rgyud sde mang po dang / snyan brgyud kun bzang a skor sogs byung ba rnams lha rje ba sgom gyis bka' gter gnyis ka gur sgom la brgyud de dar ro /

As he went off to sleep again pure bliss arose in him. On another occasion, in a dream he saw a vast bird covering almost the whole sky, on the crown (of its head) there was a boy of crystal one inch tall who was reciting the A-dkar sa-le-'od. When he woke up he (could remember) the A-dkar sa-le-'od and as he recited it his understanding returned to the state of the «primeval basis». As he recited it continuously his insight became (vast) like the sky for which he was known as sGom-chen gYung-drung-grags of Ba-rong. He rediscovered the (following) texts in the snowy (Mount) rTa-sgo: the Nang dmar-tshogs-kyi-bon and the Drang-mkhan lha-dkar-gyi-bon, etc., many exoteric, esoteric, and secret rGyud. The sNyan-brgyud kun-bzang A-skor, etc., were orally passed on to him. He transmitted both the oral word and the rediscovered texts to Gur-sgom.
(sham po'i g.ya' ma dmar po)
(The discovery in Sham-po'i g.ya-ma dmar-po)

yang sham po'i g.ya' ma dmar po nas bal zho sgom chen gyis thon pa'i sngags kyi bon sde la / rin chen gangs ri brtsegs pa'i rgyud / mdo spyi rgyud chen mo lnga / thugs rje rtse mo'i rgyud / mdzes pa me tog gi rgyud la sogs man ngag gi rgyud bcu gcig / khyung chen lding ba la sogs gsang rgyud drug / zhi ba sku'i sgrub pa la g.yung drung yongs rdzogs /
Esoteric texts were rediscovered in Sham-po'i g.ya'-ma dmar-po by Bal-zho sGom-chen. …

thig le dbyings 'chad / khro bo gsung gi sgrub pa la zla gam gcig pa khro bo mkha' 'gying gi sgrub pa / zla gam dgu pa bde gshegs rigs lnga'i sgrub pa / zla gam drug cu rtsa gcig pa dbang chen pho nya bco brgyad / zla gam brgyad pa gsang phur nag po'i sgrub pa / dbang chen thugs sgrub / dag pa sems kyi sgrub pa gsum / tshe sgrub gsum / bdud rtsi chu bo'i sgrub pa gsum / dbal mo sde bzhi'i sgrub pa / ma bdud stong bdud la sogs mang ngo /
yang 'gog po seng rdzong gi gter ni /
(The discovery in 'Gog-po seng-rdzong)

'jing ston lha dga' bya ba 'bri mtshams yen rang gi dgon pa seng grags bya bar brag phug cig yod pa la nyal bas der lung bstan byung nas gter sgo phyed pa'i bon la / bdud rtsi ba ga thigs pa'i rgyud la bdud rtsi'i sgrub pa chen mo chu sbyin che chung / shel ne tshe'i bdar gzhung / ge khod rnol ba'i this dgu dang bcas pa / ge khod chu bo glog dmar gyi rgyud dzo sgrub dang bcas pa / sgra bla thugs dkar thugs dmar gyi skor / snang gshen rtsa ba'i mdo dgu / gson gyi srog phya / gsas mkhar me ru 'khyil ba / glud khog chen mo bdud kyi zhal bsgyur sogs bon mang po yod do /

Once when 'Jing-ston lHa-dga' was sleeping in a cave (called 'Gog-po seng-rdzong) which was in the monastery called Seng-grags in 'Bri-mtshams yen-rang he was told in a prophecy that he would find a textual treasure, and he found texts there. 'Jing-ston transmitted the texts to sTag-lo Tshes-pa and the latter transmitted them to Zhang-grags of Glog-skya.
der 'jing ston mu lto ba la / stag lo tshes pas zhus / de la glog skya ba zhang grags kyis zhus te dar ro /
(rdo rje gsang phug)
(The discovery in rDo-rje gsang-phug)
yang bu mtsho srid pa'i rgyal pos gtsang stod rdo rje gsang phug nas sman sgrub bdud rtsi phum phum dgu dang / bdud rtsi sman gyi rgyud dgu thon pa gshen dam pa rgyal tshab la brgyud de dar ro /

Medical texts were rediscovered in rDo-rje gsang-phug in gTsang-stod by Bu-mtsho Srid-pa'i rGyal-po. They were the sMan-sgrub bdud-rtsi phum-phum dgu and the bDud-rtsi sman-gyi rgyud dgu. Bu-mtsho Srid-pa'i rGyal-po transmitted them to gShen Dam-pa rGyal-tshab.
(yar lha sham po)
(The discovery in Yar-lha sham-po)
dbang rma lcam me'i sras rma lha rgod thog pa'am rma ston shes rab seng ges yar lha sham po nas rnyed pa'i rtsis byang la /
Texts were rediscovered in Yar-lha sham-po by the son of rMa lCam-me, rMa lHa-rgod Thog-pa or rMa-ston Shes-rab Seng-ge.

'dul ba gsang lung / mdo mun sel sgron ma / lha gshen gyi mchod skor lnga pa / rab gnas mun sel sgron ma / du tri su mun sel sgron ma / khod spungs kyi sgrub skor / zhi khro sbrag sgrub / maN+Dal gsang skor / bon spyod bcu dgu'i rim pa / zhi ba g.yung drung yongs rdzogs / zhi khro spyi skul / rig 'dzin 'dus pa / gsang ba don 'grel / this dmar gsang ba'i rgyud / gsang this kyi skor de rnams
rma ston drang srong dang de nas zhu lhun grub 'od zer la brgyud nas dar ro /
rMa-ston Shes-rab Seng-ge transmitted the texts to rMa-ston Drang-srong and the latter transmitted them to Zhu lHun-grub 'Od-zer.
(rgyung srub gsang ba)
(The discovery in rGyung-srub gsang-ba)
yang 'jad dol gyi 'or sgom phug pa bya ba la / rma ston gyi lung bstan nas / rgyung srub gsang ba'i brag nas /
Texts were rediscovered in the rocky cave of rGyung-srub gsang-ba by 'Or-sgom Phug-pa of 'Jad-dol as had been prophesied to him by rMa-ston (Shes-rab Seng-ge).

kun bzang a dkar thig le'i sgrub skor / zhi khro yang snying cha lag dang bcas pa / gnam lcags srog 'khor / mkha' klong mdos chen mde'u kha dang bcas pa / mdos bu chung bzhi / sde brgyad zlog pa'i gzung ring / seng ge'i mdos dang bcas pa / na raka pang kong / yum sras gtor bskang / brag btsan gtor bskang la sogs
'or sgom la spa ston rin chen lhun grub kyis zhus te dar ro /
'Or-sgom Phug-pa transmitted the texts to sPa-ston Rin-chen lHun-grub.
(The discovery in Ge-khod gnyan-lung)

yang zhang zhung glang mu ne wer gyi sprul pa chu sa skyo ston dang / khyung po legs blo gnyis kyis ge khod gnyan lung nas thon pa la / ge khod lha sum brgya drug cu'i rgyud sde lnga / khro gser tso dbal thog gsum gyi rgyud sde / mda' phur nyungs kar bon gyi skor tshoms / sku bla phyi sgrub bon gyi rgyud sde / bdud rtsi sman sgrub kyi rgyud sde / gser dzwa sgrub pa'i rgyud sde / sngags thun che chung 'bring gsum la sogs byung ngo /
Texts were rediscovered in Ge-khod gnyan-lung by sKyo-ston of Chu-sa, the manifestation of Glang Mu-ne-ver of Zhang-zhung and Khyung-po Legs-blo.
(mar ston rgyal legs)
(The oral tradition of Mar-ston rGyal-legs)

yang mar ston rgyal legs la mkha' 'gro dkar mo spyan gcig mas snyan du brgyud pa la / du tri su'i zhi gcod cha lag dang bcas pa / gzhan yang phan byed kyi gdams pa mang du yod pa rnams rnal 'byor rtogs pa'i seng ge la brgyud de dar ro /

Texts were passed on orally to Mar-ston rGyal-legs by mKha'-'gro dKar-mo sPyan-gcig-ma. They were the Du-tri-su'i zhi-gcod together with the ancillary text. Also many other useful preceptive texts were passed on orally to him. He transmitted the texts to rNal-'byor rTogs-pa'i Seng-ge.
(skyid mkhar sngo phum)
(The discovery in sKyid-mkhar sngo-phug)

yang sum pa mu phyo'i sprul pa mtsho bon khyung gsas kyis skyid mkhar sngo phum nas bdud rtsi g.yu 'brang phyug mo'i skor / sman a ma ra'i sgrub skor / bdud rtsi ne'u le'i rgyud bcu gnyis / gsang sngags nang ma'i rgyud sde bzhi / sngags phyi rgyud kyi rgyud sde gnyis la sogs pa rnyed pa de zhu sgrol ba gshen rgyal la brgyud de dar ro /

Texts were rediscovered in sKyid-mkhar sngo-phug by mTsho-bon Khyung-gsas, the manifestation of Sum-pa Mu-cho. They were the cycle of the gYu-brang phyug-mo, the sMan A-ma-ra'i sgrub-skor, the bDud-rtsi ne'u-le'i rgyud bcu-gnyis, four esoteric rGyud and two exoteric rGyud, etc. mTsho-bon Khyung-gsas transmitted the teaching to Zhu sGrol-ba gShen-rgyal.
(brag dkar bya rgod)
(The discovery in Brag-dkar bya-rgod)

yang gyer mi nyi 'od kyi sprul pa spyang 'phags mu la drung mus theb chu brag dkar bya rgod nas thon pa la / g.yung drung chu 'bum gnyan 'bum lha 'bum ba ga yum 'bum sogs 'bum sde bzhi la glegs bam sum cu'am bzhi bcu yod kyang zer te / ding sang mdo khams smad phyogs sogs su bzhugs so /

Texts were rediscovered in Brag-dkar bya-rgod in Theb-chu by sKyang-'phags Mu-la Drung-mu, the manifestation of Gyer-mi Nyi-'od. They were four 'Bum: the gYung-drung chu-'bum, the gNyan-'bum, the lHa-'bum, and the Ba-ga yum-'bum in thirty volumes. Today they are in Arndo.
(dam pa rang grol)
(The oral tradition of Dam-pa Rang-grol)
de nas lung bstan las / tshe dbang rig 'dzin sprul pa ni / dam pa rang grol bya ba 'byung / zhes pa'i lung zin gyi skyes bu de la tshe dbang rig 'dzin gyis snyan du brgyud pa'i bon sde la /

The Lung-bstan says: There will be one called Dam-pa Rang-grol, The manifestation of Tshe-dbang Rig-'dzin. Texts were passed on orally to Dam-pa Rang-grol whose coming was foreseen by Tshe-dbang Rig-'dzin.

phun sum tshogs pa'i mdo sde / rin chen nor bdun skor sogs kyi mdo / khro rgyal sme brtsegs rtogs 'joms kyi skor / bskang mdos / 'ban zlog / drang chung / zhi khro thos grol skor / klu chen rigs lnga'i char 'bebs / klu chog 'o ma'i rgya mtsho / snang srid zhi ba / lha rgod drag bdar / tshan bsang / smra seng 'jam dbyangs dmar po'i skor / gtso mchog yab yum dgra brub / ltung bshags la sogs yod pa rnams
shar chung rin chen rgyal mtshan la brgyud de dar ro /
Dam-pa Rang-grol passed them on to Shar-chung Rin-chen rGyal-mtshan.
(grub thob shar pa rnal 'byor)
(The oral tradition of Grub-thob Shar-ba rNal-'byor)
yang grub thob shar pa rnal 'byor la snyan du brgyud pa'i bon la / shar pa'i don dril zab mo dang / phyi nang dge spyod kyi yan lag la sogs mang du bzhugs so /
Texts were passed on orally to Grub-thob Shar-ba rNal-'byor. They were the Shar-ba'i don-dril zab-mo, the Phyi-nang dge-spyod-kyi yan-lag, etc.
(rma rgyal gyal ga)
(The discovery in rMa-rgyal gyal-ga)
yang rig 'dzin thugs sprul gter ston g.yu lo dkar po yis rma rgyal gyal ga'i gter gnas nas rigs drug thar lam gyi mdo la sogs pa'i gdams pa zab mo 'ga' zhig thon pa'o /
Texts were rediscovered in rMa-rgyal gyal-ga by the text-discoverer gYu-lo dKar-po. They were the Rigs-drug thar-lam-gyi mdo, etc., and some other preceptive texts.
(mtho la rmog mgo)
(The discoveries in mTho-la rmog-mgo and sKabs-gnyen mtsho-nag)

yang lha bzher g.yung drung bla ma dang / bra bo rgyal ba grags pa gnyis kyis / mtho la rmog mgo'i gter gnas nas dpon gsas rig 'dzin gyi skor tshom sogs skor tshom mi 'dra ba bcu gcig dang / yang tsang ka'i skabs gnyen mtsho nag nas rdzogs chen nyi ma'i snying po / dbal phur rag+ha bdud 'dul / khro bo dbang chen rol pa / rigs drug thar lam mdo / dran pa'i sgrub skor / rgyud nyi zer sgron ma / khro bo gting zlog la sogs thon no /

Texts were rediscovered in mTho-la rmog-mgo by lHa-bzher gYung-drung Bla-ma and Bra-bo rGyal-ba Grags-pa; they were the eleven sKor-tshom (the sPon-gsas rig-dzin-gyi skor-tshom, etc.) Texts were rediscovered in sKabs-gnyen mtsho-nag of Tsong-kha; they were: the rDzogs-chen nyi-ma'i snying-po, the dBal-phur rag-sha bdud-'dul, the Khro-bo dbang-chen rol-ba, the Rigs-drug thar-lam-gyi mdo, the Dran-pa'i sgrub-skor, the rGyud nyi-zer sgron-ma, the Khro-bo gting-zlog, etc.
bra bo sgom nyag gis do khong phyogs med la gnang / des nag dpe khro rgyal rin chen la brgyud / des khong gi sras shes rab 'bum la brgyud de dar ro /
Bra-bo sGom-nyag (or rGyal-ba Grags-pa) transmitted the teaching to Do-khong Phyogs-med, the latter to Nag-dpe Khro-rgyal Rin-chen and the latter to his son Shes-rab-'bum.
(dpon gsas ma)
(The discovery of the dPon-gsas-ma)
yang dpon gsas ma'i lo rgyus la bzhi'i
The history of dPon-gsas-ma is fourfold:
dang po gter ston gyi lo rgyus ni /
(1) The life-story of the text-discoverer.

lung bstan las / dran pa'i zhal nas / nga yi mchog gi sprul pa la / dbyil ston he ru ka zhes 'byung / phyis su khyung rgod rtsal zhes grags / bon du gsang gter kha 'byed 'gyur / zhes 'byung ba de nyid yab dbyil ston rdo rje seng ge'i sras su 'khrungs / chung nas dad pa shes rab dang ldan / dgung lo nyi shu rtsa gsum na bsnyung gzhi cig byung nas de'i tshe rigs drug gi sbyong tshad zhag bdun la mthong ba byung / de dngas rjes ti se shel phug na dran pa la sogs rig 'dzin dgus phyi nang gsang ba'i dbang bskur nas gsang mtshan du khyung rgod rtsal du btags so /

The Lung-bstan by Dran-pa Nam-mkha' says: There will be one called dByil-ston He-ru-ka, The manifestation of myself, Later he will be known as Khyung-rgod-rtsal. He will reveal secret textual treasures. His father was dByil-ston rDo-rje Seng-ge. From his youth he was pious and intelligent. At the age of twenty-three he became ill and for seven days he saw the life of misery through which all beings in the six kinds of world were passing. He was frightened and went to practise meditation in Ti-se shel-phug where the nine knowledge-holders, including Dran-pa Nam-mkha', gave him outer, inner, and mystic consecrations and named him Khyung-rgod-rtsal.
gnyis pa gter thon tshul ni /
(2) The discovery of the textual treasure.

zhal bzang brag la phyin pas brag gi rked pa na maN+Dal 'dra ba'i rdo gru bzhi zhig la shel gyi g.yung drung zhig lam mer 'dug / der thag pa la phyin nas gzong brgyab pas sgo byung / de'i nang na rdo nag gi maN+Dal gru bzhi zhig gi steng na phyogs bzhi dbus lngar rdza bum la kha dog ti tshas sngo ljang du bsgyur ba lnga'i khar phur pa lnga la rang rang gi rigs rtags bris pa 'dug pa'i bum pa'i kha phyes nas shog dril rnams blangs pa'i shul 'bru sman gyis bkang / sgo sngar bzhin du bsgrigs te bzhag cing lo gcig la gsang nas spyod do /

When Khyung-rgod-rtsal went to the rock of Zhal-bzang, he saw a shining crystal swastika on a square stone like a maṇḍala in the centre of the rock. He climbed it with a rope and as he began to dig with a chisel a door appeared. Inside the door on a square, black stone like a maṇḍala there were five zinc-coloured bluish-green earthen vases in the four directions and centre. On the top of each vase there was a Phur-pa (dagger) having its own «family-sign». He opened the vases and took out the manuscripts and refilled them with grain. He replaced the door just as it was before. He kept secret (his discovery) for a year and then propagated it.
gsum pa so so'i them byang la /
(3) The textual content.

de nas byung ba'i bon sde la rdzogs chen g.yung drung klong yangs / rdzogs chen nyi ma rab gsal / rdzogs chen thig le 'dus pa / sgron ma dgu skor / dri med shel gyi snying po / thig le dgu bskor / g.yung drung lung bcu / drang don mdo dgu / nges don mdo dgu / phur pa shal 'bal ma'i skor / kun bzang rgyal 'dus kyi skor / dran pa phyi nang gsang gsum / tshe dbang phyi nang gsang gsum / bskal bzang phyi nang gsang gsum / rigs lnga mkha' 'gro'i sgrub pa / ge khod kyi skor / bstan srung yum sras lnga'i rkyang sgrub dang dril sgrub / sman rtsis la sogs byung / rgyang lha khang gi rta mgrin thugs ka nas bon la phur pa drag sgrub skor / sgrub chung nyer lnga / dran pa'i lung bstan che 'bring chung gsum / chos la rdo rje sems dpa'i mngon rtogs /

phyag rdor gyi sgrub pa / bro nad gso thabs / gu ru drag sgrub rnams byung / rgyang yon po lung nas thog ser ma bu la sogs drag sngags mang du byon / zang zang lha brag nas snyan brgyud chog drug / yang gsang rtsod zlog / tshe gzung / dran pa rdzus skyes / tshe dbang zhang zhung ma / ye dbang chen mo / gter bdag lha btsan mchod thabs rnams byon / mang mkhar lcags 'phrang nas kun rigs rgyas bsdus mde'u thung dang bcas pa / khro bo sgron ma zhi ba dang bcas pa / sde brgyad gzungs ring cha lag dang bcas pa / rgyud ting mur g.yu rtse / dbal gsas srung zlog gzir gsum / stag la spu gri dmar nag gi skor / drag po skor gsum gyi sbyin sreg / stong rgyung sgrub skor / mi bdud khrag mgo mdos dang bcas pa / gter bdag bdud btsan mched bdun gyi mchod thabs rnams byon / pra dum rta mgrin lto ba nas rta mgrin sgrub skor / rgyal po dbyug them che chung / gso dpyad bdud rtsi bum pa che chung / pad+mas mdzad pa'i gza' bcos / chung dpyad rnams byung ba gu ru chos dbang la gnang skad / yang bu la'i gangs nas g.yu dang shel sgang bon sde rnams thon skad /

ti se gangs nas nye lam sde bzhi / gtsug gtor gdugs dkar dang gdugs nag mo / gshen rab chag shing rnams byon no / gzhan yang tshe dbang gis snyan du brgyud pa'i rtog 'joms ye shes me dpung la phyi nang gsang ba'i sgrub pa gsum / zhi rgyas dbang drag gi sgrub pa bzhi / man ngag zhal shes la sogs pa mdor na bon sde bcu gsum la dbang bar bshad /
bzhi pa slob ma'i gyes tshul la /
(4) The multiplying of the disciples.

bka' bab kyi slob ma bzhi ni / smad du dar bar byed pa 'a zha blo gros rgyal mtshan dang bru 'dul ba rgyal mtshan gnyis / stod du dar bar byed pa spa mkhan chen g.yung drung seng ge dang spa ston rgyal ba shes rab gnyis te bzhi'o / de bzhi la gtug pa'i slob ma ni shin tu mang ngo /

There were Four Commissioned Ones: 'A-zha Blo-gros rGyal-mtshan and Bru 'Dul-ba rGyal-mtshan who spread the teaching in the Lower Land; the great abbot of sPa, gYung-drung Seng-ge and sPa-ston rGyal-ba Shes-rab who spread the teaching in the Upper Land. They had numerous followers.
(drung mu ha ra)
(The oral tradition of mTshan-ldan Drung-mu Ha-ra)
mtshan ldan drung mu ha ra la rig 'dzin stong rgyung mthu chen gyis snyan du brgyud pa'i bon sde la /
Texts were passed on orally to mTshan-ldan Drung-mu Ha-ra by the knowledge-holder sTong-rgyung mThu-chen.

gsang sngags yid bzhin nor bu la rgyud dang gzhung cha lag man ngag dang bcas pa / bskal bzang pod gnyis / chu sbyin / mna' bshags / sbrul mdo / stong rgyung brngan bsang / sats+tsha rig lnga / a bswe'i skor / skong ba sogs dang /

gzhan yang gtso mchog thugs 'bum la sogs 'bum sde chen po nyi shu rtsa gcig / 'khor ba sgrol mdo / rgyu 'bras mdo sogs mdo sde chen po nyi shu rtsa gcig / dpon gsas bla ma'i rgyud gzungs sogs gzungs sde chen po nyi shu rtsa gcig / bla ma rig 'dzin yi dam mkha' 'gro'i sgrub pa cha lag man ngag dang bcas pa / drang don / nges don gyi bon sde / lta sgom spyod pa'i man ngag / rig 'dzin mkha' 'gro'i zhal gdams / gab sbas gsang ba'i yig chung / rtsa rlung thig le'i nyams len / 'grel dang ti ka las tshogs la sogs shin tu rgya che ste /
de dag drung mus rtsi ra 'od zer rgyal mtshan la brgyud de dar ro /
mTshan-ldan Drung-mu Ha-ra transmitted the teaching to rTsi-ra 'Od-zer rGyal-mtshan.

yang grub thob yon tan grags rgyal dang / grub chen dbu rgyun rnam gnyis la zab pa dag snang gi bon skor la / zab mo rdzogs chen gyi skor dang / mkha' 'gro gsang lam zab mo'i bon sde mang du yod par bshad do /

d.crumb: (rnam rgyal rgya nag ma dang zhang zhung ma)

f.d: (rnam rgyal rgya nag ma dang zhang zhung ma)

d.crumb: (rnam rgyal rgya nag ma dang zhang zhung ma)

f.d: (The discovery of the rNam-rgyal rgya-nag-ma and rNam-rgyal zhang-zhung-ma)
yang rnam rgyal rgya nag ma dang zhang zhung ma'i lo rgyus la bzhi'i /
The history of the rNam-rgyal rgya-nag-ma and rNam-rgyal zhang-zhung-ma is fourfold:
dang po sbas tshul ni /
(1) The concealment of the textual treasure.
bstan pa 'phel 'grib dus su / rnam rgyal zhang zhung ma ni gyim tsha rma chung gis rag phrom na gter du sbas / rgya nag ma ni rgya nag legs tang rmang pos rgya'i mchod rten ka ru sogs su sbas so /

At the time of the suppression of Bon Gyim-tsha rMa-chung concealed the rNam-rgyal zhang-zhung-ma in Rag-phrom and Legs-tang rMang-po of China concealed the rNam-rgyal rgya-nag-ma in rGya'i mchod-rten ka-ru.
gnyis pa gter drangs tshul ni /
(2) The discovery of the textual treasure.

dran pa'i zhal nas / nga yi mchog gi sprul pa ni / dbang ldan gshen sras bya ba 'byung / spyod pa chags med rgyan shar ba / gsang gter bon gyi 'gro ba 'dren / zhes lung bstan pa'i gter ston go lde 'phags pa'am dbang ldan gshen sras lha rje'am gnyos nyi ma shes rab kyis gter gnas gnyis nas gdan drangs te / rke bu na ro'i gsang phug tu dag pa lha'i yi ge bod yig tu bsgyur nas phab pa'o / gzhan yang gshang khri lo gnam grags sogs mang du thon no /

Dran-pa (Nam-mkha') said: There will be one called dBang-ldan gShen-gsas, The manifestation of myself, Whose conduct will display non-attachment. He will discover textual treasures and deliver sentient beings to salvation. The text-discoverer Go-lde 'Phags-pa or dBang-ldan gShen-gsas lHa-rje or gNyos Nyi-ma Shes-rab discovered the textual treasures in both places, and made translations of the manuscripts into Tibetan from the language of the pure gods in the mystic cave of rKe-bu na-ro. He also found the flat-bell called Khri-lo gnam-grags and many other things.
gsum pa bon gyi them byang ni /
(3) The textual content.

rgya'i mchod rten ka ru nas thon pa la gzungs sde le'u lnga bcu rtsa lnga pa / mdo thung dang bcas pa rnams byung / khams yul rdo ti gangs dkar dang rag phrom nas rnam rgyal rtsa sgrub / bkra shis yon tan / nad yam bzlog pa / phya g.yang gi sgrub pa / gza' 'dul gtso mchog rnam 'jom / rgyud mi 'dra ba'i skor bcu byung ngo / gzhan yang gtsang gi byang phyogs g.yung drung seng mchong gi brag nas / bla med go 'phang sgrub thabs kyi mdo rgyud /
g.yung drung klong rgyas le'u nyi shu rtsa brgyad pa / kun rigs / gshen gyi dka' thub la sogs thon no / snyan brgyud kyi bka' la rdzogs chen / dran pa gser gdams skor sogs mang du yod do /
bzhi pa rgyud rim ni /
(4) The transmission.
go lde 'phags pas khyung po nang chen grags pa dang / kho rang gi dbon po dpon dge gnyis la gnang / de gnyis ka la khyung po bsod rgyal pas zhus te dar ro /
Go-lde 'Phags-pa transmitted the texts to Khyung-po Nang-chen Grags-pa and his nephew dPon-dge and they transmitted them to Khyung-po bSod-rgyal.
(pom ra ma)
(The discovery of the Pom-ra-ma)
gzhan yang pom ra ma'i lo rgyus la gsum gyi /
The history of Pom-ra-ma is threefold:
dang po gter thon tshul ni /
(1) The discovery of the textual treasure.
rma pom ra'i g.yas zur bka' rtags can gyi brag nas sprul sku kyu ra gter ston gyis thon pa'o /
Texts were rediscovered in the marked rock on the right-hand corner of rMa Pom-ra by the text-discoverer sPrul-sku Kyu-ra (Blo-gros rGyal-mtshan).
gnyis pa them byang la
(2) The textual content.

rag+sha spyi 'dul gyi skor la phyi rgyud 'od zer drwa ba / nang rgyud sgyu 'phrul drwa ba / gsang rgyud me dpung drwa ba / de la sku gsung thugs yon tan phrin las lnga'i rgyud du phyes pa / zhi khro yongs rdzogs sku'i rgyud / rag+sha dmar po gsung gi rgyud / bdud rtsi 'khyil pa thugs kyi rgyud / me ri 'khyil pa yon tan rgyud / me dpung 'bar ba phrin las rgyud dang lnga byung ngo / zhi rgyas dbang drag bzhi re phyes pa'i snang srid zhi byed sku'i rgyud / srid pa skyed byed rgyas pa'i rgyud /

khams gsum zil gnon dbang gi rgyud / dug lnga mngon sgrol drag po'i rgyud dang bzhi'o / gzhan yang sgrub gzhung cha lag kha tshar dang bcas pa / chig sgrub rta dbu dmar chung gi skor / stag la spu gri dmar nag gi gzhung cha lag sogs mang du byon no /
gsum pa slob rgyud ni /
(3) The transmission of the teaching to his disciples.

sprul sku kyu ra la bka' babs kyi bu chen bzhi yod do / zhi khro yongs rdzogs kyi bka' tsong ka'i dge bshes la bab / thugs sgrub kyi bka' 'dan ma ri pa la bab / go cha che chung gi bka' rko ston g.yung drung la bab / sgrol byed spu gri sum cu'i bka' khrom a dpal la bab cing de dag so so nas dar ro / khyad par du gter ston gyi dbon po shes rab 'od zer la rgya ru khro bo rgyal mtshan gyis zhus te dar ro /

There were the Four Commissioned Ones: sPrul-sku Kyu-ra commissioned the Zhi-khro yongs-rdzogs to Tsong-kha'i dGe-bshes, the Thugs-sgrub to 'Dan-ma Ri-ba, the Go-cha che-chung to rKo-ston gYung-drung and the sGrol-byed spu-gri sum-cu to Khrom A-dpal. On request the nephew of the text-discoverer (sPrul-sku Kyu-ra) Shes-rab 'Od-zer transmitted the whole teaching to rGya-ru Khro-bo rGyal-mtshan.
(g.yung drung gling pa)
(The discoveries of Bon-zhig gYung-drung Gling-pa)

yang bon zhig g.yung drung gling pa'am rdo rje gling pa'ang zer ba de nyid kyi dgung lo nyer gsum par bai ros sbas pa'i spa gro stag tshang nas rdzogs chen gser thur / dran pa yab sras kyi sgrub pa cha lag bcas / pom ra'i skor / nyang stod phyug mo dpal ri nas tshe dbang bod yul ma zhes pa'i gzhung cha lag khrid yig skor /

At the age of twenty-three Bon-zhig gYung-drung Gling-pa rediscovered the rDzogs-chen gser-thur, the Dran-pa yab-sras-kyi sgrub-pa together with the ancillary text and the Pom-ra cycle which had been concealed by Vairocana in sPa-gro stag-tshang. On the mount of Phyug-mo-dpal in Nyang-stod he rediscovered the Tshe-dbang bod-yul-ma comprising the basic text, the ancillary texts and the instructive texts.

byang gi sha ba ri nas bon sku kun bzang gi khrid yig / srung ma srid rgyal drel dkar ma / longs sku rigs lnga'i khrid yig / srung ma drel dmar ma / sprul sku gshen rab kyi khrid yig / srung ma drel nag ma / bai ro tsa nA'i rnam thar / ma 'ong lung bstan / re kyang shang mtha' nas lha klu'i nor bu / ne'u chung gi rna g.yu dkar chags dang bcas pa / btsan sgrub skor / gtsang 'phrang lha khang gi them 'og tu b+ho d+hi sa twos mnan pa'i gshen rab kyi sku gzugs g.yu gar ljang las grub pa ngo mtshar che ba thon pa da lta rgyal rigs bru'i phyag na bzhugs so /

On the Mount of Sha-ba in the North he rediscovered the following texts: the Bon-sku kun-bzang-gi khrid-yig together with the Srung-ma srid-rgyal drel-dkar-ma; the Longs-sku rigs-lnga'i khrid-yig together with the Srung-ma (srid-rgyal) drel-nag-ma, the sPrul-sku gShen-rab-kyi khrid-yig together with the Srung-ma (srid-rgyal) drel-nag ma, the biography of Vairocana, and the Ma-'ong lung-bstan. He also found a «wishing jewel» of gods and water-spirits and the ear-turquoise of Ne'u-chung together with its history and the bTsan cycle in Re-kyang shang-mtha'. Underneath the threshold of the temple in gTsang-'phrang he found a wonderful image of gShen-rab made of light-green turquoise which had been relegated there by Bodhi Sattva. Now the image is kept in the hand of royal Bru.
slob brgyud la tshe dbang gi skor rnams gter ston gyis mtha' bzhi ye shes rang shar la brgyud de lung zin bu dgu sogs nas dar ro /
Bon-zhig gYung-drung Gling-pa transmitted the Tshe-dbang cycle to mTha'-bzhi Ye-shes Rang-shar and then it descended to the nine foreknown spiritual sons.
dran pa'i skor la sogs bru mtshungs med bsod nams blo gros la brgyud / des rdza bo g.yung drung rgyal mtshan la brgyud de dar ro /
Bon-zhig gYung-drung Gling-pa transmitted the Dran-pa cycle, etc., to Bru mTshungs-med bSod-nams Blo-gros and the latter transmitted them to rDza-bo gYung-drung rGyal-mtshan.

d.crumb: (bru mtshungs med bsod nams blo gros)

f.d: (bru mtshungs med bsod nams blo gros)

d.crumb: (bru mtshungs med bsod nams blo gros)

f.d: (The works of Bru mTshungs-med bSod-nams Blo-gros)

tshe dbang bod yul ma'i lung bstan las / khye'u chung thugs kyi sprul pa la / bru la bsod nams mtshan can 'byung / de dang gang 'brel thar pa 'thob / ces pa'i lung zin gyi bru mtshungs med bsod nams blo gros la

The Tshe-dbang bod-yul-ma'i lung-bstan says: In the family of Bru there will be one whose name is bSod-nams, The manifestation of (Yid-kyi) Khye'u-chung, He who makes contact with him will attain salvation. Bru mTshungs-med bSod-nams Blo-gros, whose coming had been predicted, wrote several books:

mdzod kyi gzhal bya bsdus pa /gsang sngags ngag don / spyi spungs sdom tshig nang bskyed kyi rtsa 'khor gnas lugs sogs bka' brten dang / dpon gsas bla ma'i sgrub thabs / pom ra shel khrab kyi skor sogs dag snang gi las tshogs dang / rnam sras zhal gzigs kyi bstod bskul sogs khyad par 'phags pa'i bon skor mang du yod do /

They were the mDzod-kyi gzhal-bya bsdus-pa, the gSang-sngags ngag-don, the sPyi-spungs sdom-tshig nang-bskyed-kyi rtsa-khor gnas-lugs, etc. He also composed many rites: the dPon-gsas bla-ma'i sgrub-thabs, the Pom-ra cycle, the Shel-khrab cycle, the rNam-sras zhal-gzigs-kyi bstod-bskul, etc.
(yang dben yer ba'i brag rdzong)
(The discovery in Yang-dben yer-ba'i brag-rdzong)

gzhan yang gang ston klu ston rnam gnyis kyis kyang yang dben yer ba'i brag rdzong nas snang ba 'od ldan gyi rgyud dang sgrub skor / gnam phyi'i bdud rtsi bum sgrub / zhang zhung bon skor lha rgod drag gdar la sogs mang du thon par bshad do /

Texts were rediscovered in Yang-dben yer-ba'i brag-rdzong by Gang-ston and Klu-ston. They were the sNang-ba 'od-ldan-gyi rgyud, the gNam-phyi'i bdud-rtsi bum-sgrub, and the Zhang-zhung-bon lha-rgod drag-bdar, etc.
(sgom pa rin chen)
(The discovery of sGom-pa Rin-chen)

yang khams kyi drang srong sgom pa rin chen gyis rma rgyal pom ra'i g.yas zur nas rdzogs chen nyi ma'i snying po / dbal phur nag po bdud 'dul gyi skor / khro bo dbang chen rol pa sogs sgrub chen mang po gter las thon par bshad pa snang ngo /

Texts are said to have been rediscovered in the right-hand corner of rMa-rgyal Pom-ra by the monk sGom-pa Rin-chen of Khams. They were the rDzogs-chen nyi-ma'i snying-po, the dBal-phur nag-po bdud-'dul cycle, and the Khro-bo dbang-chen rol-ba, etc.
(sku bla gangs brag)
(The discovery in sKu-bla gangs-brag)
yang kong po gter ston gung grags bya bas sku bla gangs brag nas drangs pa'i mdo sde bskal pa bzang po pod gnyis dang / bon spyod la sogs mang du thon no /
Texts were rediscovered in sKu-bla gangs-brag by the text-discoverer Gung-grags of Kong-po. They were the mDo-sde bskal-pa bzang-po in two volumes, the Bon-spyod, etc.
(khom mthing)
(The discovery in the temple of Khom-mthing)

yang khyung po lha bzher / nyang dpal mthong / zhang zhung lha sgra gsum gyis khom mthing lha khang gi dkor mdzod dang por sbas pa / phyis su la stod spa bon khyung thog dang rgyud ston ra dza gnyis kyis bton pa la / snang gshen gyi rgyud g.yung drung gsal byed / rtsa ba rin chen rgya mdud / bon khog srid pa rnam grol / lag len rin chen sgron ma la sogs rgyu'i bon mang po'i dngos grub brnyes te / de'i sras lha 'od dkar dang / des g.yor po gnyer ston la brgyud de dar ro /

Many texts of the «Bon of Cause» were concealed by Khyung-po lHa-bzher, Nyang dPal-mthong and lHa-sgra of Zhang-zhung in the first treasury of the temple of Khom-mthing. Later the texts were rediscovered by sPa-bon Khyung-thog and rGyud-ston Ra-dza of La-stod. They were the sNang-gshen-rgyud g.yung-drung gsal-byed, the rTsa-ba rin-chen rgya-mdud, the Bon-khog srid-pa rnam-grol, the Lag-len rin-chen sgron-ma, etc. sPa-bon Khyung-thog and rGyud-ston Ra-dza transmitted the texts to lHa 'Od-dkar and the latter to gNyer-ston of gYor-po.
(bsam yas ca ti dmar po)
(The discovery in bSam-yas ca-ti dmar-po)

yang sprul sku bu kyi bu nam gyis bsam yas ca ti dmar po nas gter nas thon pa'i shog ser glang 'od la thung gi phyag tu babs te / brda yig bkrol ba las a bswe brag btsan sgrub skor than srog dril sgrub la sogs pa byung ba rnams / khyung po nang chen grags pa la brgyud / des bsod rgyal pa la brgyud de dar ro /

sPrul-sku Bu-kyi Bu-nam rediscovered a manuscript in bSam-yas ca-ti dmar-po and handed it over to Glang-'od La-thung who, after deciphering the symbolic letters of the manuscript, produced the following texts: the A-bswe brag-btsan sgrub-skor, and the Than-srog dril-sgrub, etc., Glang-'od La-thung transmitted the texts to Khyung-po Nang-chen Grags-pa and the latter to bSod-rgyal.
(rin chen brag rdzong)
(The discovery in Rin-chen brag-rdzong)
yang rdzong brag bla ma dbu rnal bya bas gtsang gi rin chen brag rdzong nas / dmag dpon gsang sgrub la sogs thon par bshad do /
Texts were apparently rediscovered in Rin-chen brag-rdzong in gTsang by Bla-ma dBu-mal of rDzong-brag. They were the dMag-dpon gsang-sgrub, etc.
(lha sa'i phur sgo)
(The discovery in the East of lHa-sa'i phur-sgo)

yang sbas kyi dang la 'byams pa dang khyung po klu mgon gnyis kyis lha sa'i phur sgo'i shar phyogs nas drang pa'i bon sde la / mgon lha dkar po'i sgrub tshogs / dbal dang ma tshogs kyi sgrub pa / gsang sgrub che chung rgyud sde / gsang ba 'phrul gyi lde mig / drang don gyi rgyud sde / mtho thog spyi rgyug gi bon sde 'ga' zhig byon no /

Texts were rediscovered in the East of lHa-sa'i phur-sgo by sBas Dang-la 'Byams-pa and Khyung-po Klu-mgon. They were the mGon-lha dkar-po sgrub-tshogs, the dBal dang ma-tshogs-kyi sgrub-pa, the gSang-sgrub che-chung rgyud-sde, the gSang-ba 'phrul-gyi lde-mig, the Drang-don-gyi rgyud-sde, and some texts of the mTho-thog spyi-rgyug-gi bon.
(lho ri nag po)
(The discovery in lHo-ri nag-po)

yang gnam gshen mthong grags kyi sprul pa gter ston khu 'dzin 'jing nag gis lho ri nag po nas thon pa'i bon sde la / bdud kyi gzhung sgrub / btsan sgrub che chung / klu'i mnan gtad snying gzer / gsas mkhar dbang gi ti ka / gsas mkhar rgyud mo che / lha bran bon sde rnams yod do /

Texts were rediscovered in lHo-ri nag-po by the text-discoverer Khu-'dzin 'Jing-nag, the manifestation of gNam-gshen mThong-grags. They were the bDud-kyi bzhung-sgrub, the bTsan-sgrub che-chung, the Klu'i mnan-gtad snying-gzer, the gSas-mkhar dbang-gi ti-ka, the gSas-mkhar rgyud-mo-che, and the lHa-bran bon-sde.
(sprul sku la byi rda rma)
(The discovery of sPrul-sku La-byi rDa-rma)

yang sprul sku la byi rda rma la brag btsan gyis lung bstan nas a bswe'i thugs sgrub las tshogs drug pa la sogs man ngag gi skor mang po byon pa rnams / a khol do skya bsod nams rgyal mtshan la brgyud de dar ro /

sPrul-sku La-byi rDa-rma, as foretold to him in prophecy by Brag-btsan, rediscovered the following texts: the A-bswe thugs-sgrub las-tshogs drug-pa, etc. He transmitted the texts to Do-skya bSod-nams rGyal-mtshan of A-khol.
(brag dmar rtse gsum)
(The discovery in Brag-dmar rtse-gsum)

yang ma hor stag gzig gi sprul pa lo pa'i rngon pa ma ngor gyis brag dmar rtse gsum nas thon pa la / gshen rab lha mdzod chen po'i rgyud / 'khor lo rgyud sbyang gi rgyud sde / gshin 'dur phra mo'i rgyud sde / 'dus byas bon gyi rgyud sde ste / rgyud dang sgrub phran mi 'dra ba dgu byung bar bshad do /

Texts were rediscovered in Brag-dmar rtse-gsum by the hunter, Lo-pa Ma-ngor, the manifestation of Ma-hor sTag-gzig. He is said to have rediscovered nine different rGyud such as the gShen-rab lha-mdzod chen-po'i rgyud, the 'Khor-lo rgyud-sbyang-gi rgyud, the gShin-'dur phra-mo'i rgyud, the 'Dus-byas bon-gyi rgyud, etc.
(se gnyan zhig po)
(The discovery of Se-gnyan Zhig-po)
yang rgya rong se gnyan zhig pos dmu rdo g.yung drung spungs rtse'i g.yas zur nas bswe sgrom gsum thon pa'i bon sde la /
Se-gnyan Zhig-po of rGya-rong rediscovered three boxes of texts in the right-hand corner of dMu-rdo g.yung-drung spungs-rtse in rGya-rong. The content of the boxes.

sgrom bu gcig las 'dul ba rgyud 'bum la glegs bam drug / rtsa 'dus kyi 'bum la sogs 'bum gyi sde dang / bdud rtsi bcud 'bebs thig le / 'byung ba gting rdzogs khu byug mdo / bdud rtsi dpyad mdo / mtha' sel mdo / g.yung drung spyi phud nam mkha'i mdo / zhi byed mdo sogs mdo yi sde dang / rdzogs chen mu med bdal pa'i rgyud / yang gsang bla med lde mig rgyud / tan+d+ra gsang ba sems kyi rgyud / thig le grub pa'i me long rgyud / rin chen spyi spungs rtsa ba'i rgyud / gting zlog gi rgyud / ma mo'i rgyud / ge shan sgrol byed dbal mo'i rgyud / myur mgyogs drag po thog 'bebs rgyud / 'byung 'khrug phyag cha sum cu'i rgyud / gsang ba dgu 'dus pra shan rgyud / bzlas chog rgyud la sogs rgyud sum cu byung / bswe sgrom gcig la brda tshom skor / gsas mkhar sum brgya'i byung khungs / gsang 'dus rtsa 'grel / gab pa'i skor / sangs rgyas mdo / snang gsal mdo /

khams 'grel man ngag bcu drug / sbas yig / dus kyi rtsis byang / lung dang man ngag kha byang sogs bon sde lnga gsum bco lnga byung / bswe sgrom gcig las gyim bu'i snang rabs gto / srid rabs 'dur / rdzu 'phrul skor gsum / 'byung sel / ye ngam rgyud sde / mu cho'i khrom 'dur / nad sel skor / sbyang rgyud bdun skor / zhi bcos dregs pa dgu'i skor / gnyen chen sde drug / sa bdag 'khrug sbyor / kong tse'i gto / rno mthong / drag sngags / rgyud dgu / mi mgo skad 'don me dpung rgyud / gar gsas rgyud / rdzas sbyor / 'phrul che'i ya stag rgyud la sogs bon sde nyi shu rtsa gsum byung bar bshad do /
(mu la thog med)
(The oral tradition of Gling-gshen Mu-la Thogs-med)

yang gling zhig mu la thog med la stong rgyung gis snyan du brgyud pa'i gser 'od nor bu 'od 'bar dang / gzhan yang char 'bebs klu sgrub kyi skor / sgra bla rgyal mo'i skor sogs yod do / yang gter ston gu ru ban chung gi zangs 'brug 'khyil pa nas ku be ra'i sgrub skor / char 'beb yang dag ma'i skor dang / rgya rong 'brug ri khyung mgo nas / yongs su dag pa'i bon skor /

Texts were passed on orally to Gling-gshen Mu-la Thogs-med by sTong-rgyung (mThu-chen). They were the gSer-'od nor-bu 'od-bar, the cycle of the Char-'bebs klu-sgrub, the sGra-bla rgyal-mo cycle, etc. (The discoveries of Gu-ru Ban-chung) In Zangs-'brug 'khyil-ba the text-discoverer Gu-ru Ban-chung found the Ku-wai-ra cycle, and the cycle of the Char-'beb yang-dag-ma. In 'Brug-ri khung-mgo in rGya-rong he found the Yongs-su Dag-pa cycle, and the

gsas mkhar me ri 'khyil pa dang / khams kyi gnyan tshungs nas / mdo dung lo ljon pa / g.yu lo ljon pa / gser lo ljon pa / zangs lo ljon pa ste mdo bzhi rma pom ra nas rab gnas spur chog la sogs rnyed do /

gSas-mkhar me-ri 'khyil-ba. In gNyan-tshungs in Khams he found four mDo; the Dung-lo ljon-pa, the gYu-lo ljon-pa, the gSer-lo ljon-pa, and the Zangs-lo ljon-pa. In rMa Pom-ra he found the Rab-gnas spur-chog, etc.
(rdo thi gangs dkar)
(The discovery in rDo-di gangs-dkar)
yang gter ston lhun grub thog med kyis / rdo thi gangs dkar la dran pa sogs grub pa'i gshen dgus sbas pa'i skye sgo gcod pa'i mdo la sogs zab pa'i bon sde 'ga' zhig dngos grub tu rnyed do /
The text-discoverer lHun-grub Thogs-med came upon profound texts such as the sKye-sgo gcod-pa'i mdo, etc., which had been concealed in rDo-di gangs-dkar by the nine priests: Dran-pa (Nam-mkha'), etc.
(rdza bo rig pa rang shar)
(The oral tradition of rDza-bo Rig-pa Rang-shar)

yang rgya rong dmu rdo'i nub phyogs kyi rdza bo rig pa rang shar la tshe dbang rig 'dzin gyis snyan du brgyud pa'i bon sde la rdzogs chen lta ba thog 'bebs kyi klad gzhung mjug la sa gcod bco lnga 'grel pa dang bcas pa dang / gzhan yang gsang 'dus khyung sprul sad srung gi skor / gsang sngags phyi nang gsang gsum / drang mkhan la sogs mang du yod do /

Texts were passed on orally to rDza-bo Rig-pa Rang-shar by Tshe-dbang Rig-'dzin in the West of dMu-rdo in rGya-rong. They were the rDzogs-chen lta-ba thog-bebs together with its commentary. Also the cycle of the gSang-'dus khyung-sprul sad-srung, the Drang-mkhan, etc.
(sbar zhabs brag)
(The discoveries of Gyer Thogs-med)
sbar zhabs brag nas gter thon tshul la /
A.
dang po sbas tshul ni /
(1) The concealment of the textual treasure.

bon dar nub kyi dus su legs tang rmang pos bon sde du ma mdo smad sbar zhabs brag dkar gyi phrag pa g.yas gong brag seng ge'i kha gdangs pa 'dra ba'i gong du gtad rgya kha byang smon lam dang bcas sbas so /

At the time of the suppression of Bon Legs-tang rMang-po concealed many texts at the top of a rock like a lion opening its mouth wide, and in the right-hand shoulder of sBar-zhabs brag-dkar in mDo-smad together with the guide and sealed them up. He said prayers.
gnyis pa gter ston ni /
(2) Concerning the text-discoverer,
srid pa rgyud kyi kha byang las / zla ba rgyal mtshan gyi rnam 'phrul dbra rigs gyer thogs med bya bas / sbar zhabs brag dkar gyi gter sgo phye / zhes pa de nyid do /
the Srid-pa rgyud-kyi kha-byang says: A man called Gyer Thogs-med of the family of dBra, the manifestation of Zla-ba rGyal-mtshan, will open the door of the textual treasure in sBar-zhabs brag-dkar.
gsum pa gter thon tshul la /
(3) The discovery of the textual treasure.
rtsa ba dang / yan lag gnyis kyi /
(AA) stem and (BB) branches.
dang po sbar zhabs brag gi gter thon tshul ni /
(AA)

dgung lo nyi shu rtsa gnyis bzhes tshe rig 'dzin gyi lung bstan byung ste / nyams snang du rnal 'byor pa mang du byung ba'i nang nas a tsa ra'i cha byad can zhig na re / nged rnams ni rgya gar dang zhang zhung yul nas 'ong / smad du sbar zhabs brag dkar du bon gyi gsang gter yod pa thon cig zer / der phyin nas bzhugs pas gter srung gi cho 'phrul sna tshogs byung skad / de nas srid pa rgyal mos zhal bstan te brag dkar gyi gong la btsas kyi dkyil du rdo ring la gter gyi kha byang bris nas yod gsungs pa bzhin btsal bas / rdo ring gi ngos su 'di nas 'og tu khru gang na gter yod / 'di drang ba'i mis gter srung la lug nag spyi dkar zhig phul la gter khung du rin po che sna lnga'i bum gter zhog / zla ba dgu'i bar du gsang rgya sbas rgya u ya ag+thaM zer ba rnyed do /

When Gyer Thogs-med was twenty-two in a vision he saw many ascetics, one of whom, having the appearance of an ācārya, said to him: «We have come here from India and Zhang-zhung. In sBar-zhabs brag-dkar in mDo-smad there is a secret textual treasure and you are to take it out.» When he went to the place and was staying there the Textual Guardian displayed various miracles to him. Then Srid-pa rGyal-mo letting him see her face said to him: «In the centre of the cairn of sBar-zhabs brag-dkar there is a guide to the textual treasure written on a long stone.» Accordingly after searching he found the long stone on which (the following instruction) was written: «At a cubit’s length beneath this point is the textual treasure. He who takes it out should make an offering of a black sheep with a white head to the Textual Guardian and place a vase containing five jewels in the place of the textual treasure. He should keep his discovery secret for nine months.»
de nas brkos pas shog ser rnams byung ste /
Then as he began to dig manuscripts appeared.

bod yig tu phab pa'i them byang ni / shes rab rdzogs pa gsang ba'i 'bum / 'khor ba dong sprug gi mdo / yid bzhin nor bu gser 'od kyi gzungs / rdzogs chen mngon rtogs lta ba'i rgyal po / srid pa rgyud kyi bsgrags byang chen mo / rig 'dzin brgyad cu'i mtshan phyag / zhi khro bcud dril / gsang sngags skor tshom / dbal khyung dmar po'i sgrub skor / lha rgod sku rdzogs kyi sgrub pa / gsang sngags gzer bu bcu pa / phur pa'i srung zlog stong thun dang bcas pa / srid pa rgyal mo las kyi tan+tra / dran pa thugs sgrub / tshe dbang gsang sgrub / bskal bzang sogs mkha' 'gro rigs lnga'i sgrub pa / thugs rje kun sgrol skor / spu gri nag po'i bsad pa / dmod mo bsad pa dgu sgril / sgra bla ma dang yum sras kyi skor / dbal bon ram po'i dri khams gnyen po / mi bdud sum sgril bsad pa'i tan+tra / mkha' 'gro'i srog yig / bsad pa'i mde'u thung / yum gcod / ye snying char 'beb / bdud rtsi ra sa ya na'i rgyud / phan byed nyer gcig / gnod byed nyer gcig /

a ma dred de khyung nag gi sgrub pa / yas stag rtsi shing rang 'gros / mar bon bco brgyad / gyer bon skor / lha srin gtad pa rdzong 'debs bcas klu gnyan sa bdag gtad sprug skor / klu bdud snying gzer sogs byung ngo /

gter khung nas 'jal ba'i mda' do'i sa na phug pa gnyis kyi bar du mtsho nag zangs kha tsam gyi dkyil na sbrul nag po mdung tsam zhig 'dug / mtsho'i 'gram du yas stag rang 'gros kyi skor rnams 'dug ste ma drangs so / phug pa'i nang na rin po che'i zhal bu sna tshogs 'dug pas 'gro bsam kyang / sbrul de'i 'jigs tshul bstan pas 'gro ma nus / phug pa phyi ma na gshen rab kyi ring srel cha lnga / bram ze skye bdun gyi thod pa dang bcas pa gdan drangs so /

Two arrows’ lengths away from here there were two caves with a black pool like a copper bowl between them, in which there was a black snake the size of a spear. Beside the pool was the cycle of the Yas-stag rang-'gros, but he did not take it out. Since in the inner cave there were various cups made of precious stones, he wished to go into it, but as the snake began to look ferocious, he did not dare. In the outer cave there were ten relics of gShen-rab and the skull of Bram-ze sKye-bdun. He took these.
gnyis pa yan lag gi gter la gsum gyi /
(BB)
dang po sbas tshul ni /
(1) The concealment of the textual treasure in rTa-gnyan pha-bong bon-mo.
lo chen bai ro tsa nas rta gnyan pha bong bon mdzod du sbas te smon lam gyis rgyas btab po /
The great lo-tsā-ba Vairocana concealed a textual treasure in rTa-gnyan pha-bong bon-mo and said prayers.
gnyis pa gter drangs tshul ni /
(2) The discovery of the textual treasure.
nyin gcig nyams snang la rnal 'byor pa kha TAM bsnams pa zhig gis bskal pa bzang mo'i bsnyen pa la 'bad na dngos grub 'byung gis zhes zer ba byung /
One day in a vision Gyer Thogs-med saw an ascetic carrying a trident who said to him: «If you take care to venerate sKal-pa bZang-mo you will receive a gift.»

de'i phyi lor khye'u dar dkar gyon pa zhig byung nas / khyod la las 'phro yod pas lta gnyan pha wang bon mo'i gter rnams / lcags pho khyi la drongs la / lcags mo phag la sgrogs shig zer ba byung / ston zla ra ba'i tshes bcu gnyis kyi tho rangs su / mi dmar dar dmar gyi na bza' can bswe rmog gyon pa / lag na sbrul zhags bzung zhing rta dmar zhon pa zhig gis / nga ni btsan rgod dmar po yin / nga'i rjes su shog dang pha bong bon mo la dngos grub yod pa sbyin zer nas rlung tshub cig tu brdzus te song / nangs par der phyin pas srod thun la srid pa rgyal mos 'di nas mar mtho bdun 'jal ba'i sa na kha byang yod ces lung bstan pa bzhin btsal bas kha byang byung ste 'di nas mar 'dom gsum gcal ba'i sar brag la sgo rang dod kyi nang du rgyud sde sum cu rtsa bzhi dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ring srel dang gser sku gser 'bum yod ces pa byung / der brag la sgo rang dod la rdo'i kha leb sprad pa zhig 'dug pa kha phyes nas sangs rgyas gser sku gser 'bum shog dril mang po yod pa rnams dngos grub tu blangs so /

The following year in a vision he saw a boy wearing white silk who said to him: «In consequence of your previous acts you are to take the textual treasure of rTa-gnyan pha-bong bon-mo in the Iron-male dog year and propagate it in the Iron-female pig year.» In the early morning on the twelfth of the first autumn month (of the Iron-dog year) a red man wearing a red silk robe and a tanned leather helmet, riding on a red horse and carrying a noose of snake in his hand said to him: «I am bTsan-rgod dMar-po. Follow me and I will give you the gift which is in (rTa-gnyan) pha-bong bon-mo.» Having said that he disappeared by transforming himself into a hurricane. In the evening Gyer was told in a prophecy by Srid-pa rGyal-mo: «Seven spans away from here there is a guide to the textual treasure.» In the morning he went to the place where after searching for a while he found the guide. It said: «Three fathoms down from here there is a self-made door in the rock. Inside there are thirty-four rGyud, the relics of Enlightened Ones, golden images, and the 'Bum written in gold.» He opened the self-made door in the rock which was closed with a flat stone. He took out the golden images, the 'Bum written in gold and all the manuscripts (of thirty-four rGyud).
gsum pa them byang ni /
(3) The textual content.

srid pa rgyud kyi kha byang chen mo / rig 'dzin pho byang / mkha' 'gro mo byang / bai ro'i rdzogs chen yang tig bsdus pa / bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi nad kyi gnyen po bdud rtsi ha sa ra'i 'grel pa / mu bdud kham pa'i srog sgrub / btsan bdud he ru kha'i drag sgrub / btsan rgod dmar po'i tan+tra / gzhan yang tshe sgrub nyi shu rtsa gcig / srung ba nyer gcig / zlog pa nyer gcig / bsad pa nyer gcig / rdzas sbyor nyer gcig / rten 'brel sbyor ba nyer gcig / nor sgrub nyer gcig / dbang sdud nyer gcig / dgra brub nyer gcig / mnan pa nyer gcig rnams byung ngo / snyan brgyud la bskal bzang pod gnyis / tshe dbang bya ri ma / char 'bebs skor / pom ra'i skor rnams yod do /
bzhi pa slob ma'i gyes tshul ni / dung dkar thogs pa bdun la sogs mang du byung zhing / khyad par du bka' bab chen po bzhis kun tu spel te ches cher dar ro /

(4) The multiplying of the disciples. Gyer Thogs-med had many followers such as the Seven Dung-dkar Thogs-pa, etc., and in particular there were the Four Commissioned Ones who spread the teaching far and wide.
(sprul sku blo ldan snying po)
(The oral tradition of sPrul-sku Blo-ldan sNying-po)
yang sprul sku blo ldan snying po la stang chen dmu tsha gyer med sogs rig 'dzin mkha' 'gros snyan du brgyud pa'i bon skor la bzhi'i /
Texts were passed on orally to sPrul-sku Blo-ldan sNying-po by the knowledge-holders and mystic goddesses such as sTang-chen dMu-tsha Gyer-med, etc. They were in four groups.

dang po phyi mdo la dri med gzi brjid bstan pa'i mdo la glegs bam bcu gnyis / dri med rtsa ba'i mdo dang bcu gsum sangs rgyas khri dang bdun stong gi mtshan brjod mdo / lhun po brtsegs pa rgyud kyi mdo / bkra shis dpal 'bar khab kyi mdo dang bzhi / gnyis pa nang sngags la rol pa gzungs sngags / phur pa rigs sngags / brtsod zlog drag sngags / zhi khro rab 'byams yang gsang gi sngags dang bzhi / gsum pa gsang ba la rig pa khu byug yab kyi rgyud / rig 'dzin 'dus pa thabs kyi rgyud / mkha' 'gro yang snying shes rab kyi rgyud gsum / bzhi pa yang gsang bla med la nam mkha' spyi gcod lta ba'i rgyud la sogs pa mang du yod do /
sprul sku blo ldan nas / b+he tsha grags pa rgyal mtshan sogs la brgyud nas dar ro /
sPrul-sku Blo-ldan sNying-po transmitted the texts to Bhe-tsha Grags-pa rGyal-mtshan, etc., and so they flourished.

d.crumb: (dmu rgyal sprul sku nyi ma rgyal mtshan)

f.d: (dmu rgyal sprul sku nyi ma rgyal mtshan)

d.crumb: (dmu rgyal sprul sku nyi ma rgyal mtshan)

f.d: (The mental textual treasure of dMu-gshen Nyi-ma rGyal-mtshan)

yang gsang mchog mthar thug gis byin gyis brlabs pas dgongs gter nam mkha'i mdzod la mnga' bsnyems shing / dkyil 'khor stong dang drug brgya la nges pa'i snang ba rgyas pa'i dmu rgyal sprul sku nyi ma rgyal mtshan gyi dgongs gter dkyil 'khor bcu drug la sogs glegs bam bcu gnyis yod do /

As dMu-gshen Nyi-ma rGyal-mtshan was blessed by gSang-mchog mThar-thug he obtained power over a vast treasury of mental textual treasure and his enlightened understanding of the one thousand six hundred maṇḍala was immense. His mental textual treasure consists of twelve volumes, including the dKyil-'khor bcu-drug, etc.
(sprul sku khro gnyen)
(The oral tradition of sPrul-sku Khro-gnyen rGyal-mtshan)
yang sprul sku khro gnyen gyi snyan rgyud bskal bzang mdo pod gnyis / gsang gcod yid bzhin nor bu'i skor sogs mang du yod do /
Texts were passed on orally to sPrul-sku Khro-gnyen. They were the bsKal-bzang mdo in two volumes, the cycle of the gSang-gcod yid-bzhin nor-bu, etc.
(ra sa rdzang mgo)
(The discovery in Ra-sa rdzong-mgo)

gzhan yang gter ston 'tsho sprul bya bas lci'i ra sa rdzang mgo nas dran pa yab sras kyi dbang bum dngul bum cha gcig / bon sde la kun bzang thugs sgrub rin chen sgron ma / ge khod me ri gyad phur gyi gzhung mchod skor dang bcas pa byung ba la / kun bzang sgrub skor rnams dar zhing / ge khod skor rnams bu dpe la ma phab cing / shog ser dngos dang dngul bum gcig ding sang dpon rgyud kyi phyag na yod la / dngul bum gcig dbang ldan zhu tshang gi phyag na yod do /

The text-discoverer called 'Tsho-sprul found a pair of silver vases which had been used at consecrations by Dran-pa (Nam-mkha'), the father, and (Tshe-dbang Rig-'dzin) his son, in Ra-sa rdzong-mgo in lCi. 'Tsho-sprul also found the text of the Kun-bzang thugs-sgrub rin-chen sgron-me and the Ge-khod me-ri gyad-phur-gyi gzhung-mchod. The former has become widely known but the latter has never been transcribed. The original manuscripts and one of the silver vases have remained in the hands of his descendants till this day. The other silver vase is in the hands of the powerful Zhu.
(kha shu ra 'dra)
(The discovery in Kha-shu ra-'dra)
yang u go g.yung drung 'bum bya bas kha shu ra 'dra nas khro bo dbang drag / gsang gcod / gsang ba 'bum chen sogs thon no /
Texts were rediscovered in Kha-shu ra-'dra by U-go gYung-drung-'bum. They were the Khro-bo dbang-drag, the gSang-gcod, the gSang-ba 'bum-chen, etc.
(pha bong gru bzhi)
(The discovery in Pha-bong gru-bzhi)

yang pho che nam mkha' 'od zer dang / gar tsha bsod nams rgyal mtshan gnyis kyis 'jing gi pha bong gru bzhi nas / khro klong rnam gsum / pom ra'i sgrub skor dang / gshen rab ljags mchil las grub pa'i sha ri ram cha gnyis / kha byang shog ser rnams drangs te / sha rI ram dang shog ser ni ding sang dbon rgyud kyi phyag na bzhugs so /

Texts were rediscovered in Pha-bong gru-bzhi of 'Jing by Pho-chen Nam-mkha' 'Od-zer and Gar-tsha bSod-nams rGyal-mtshan. They were the Khro-klong rnam-gsum and the Pom-ra'i sgrub-skor. They also found four sharīrām made from the spittle of gShen-rab. The sharīrām, the guide, and the manuscripts have remained in the hands of their descendants till this day.
(brag dmar ke ru)
(The discovery in Brag-dmar ke-ru)

yang srid rgyud las / tshe dbang rig 'dzin rnam 'phrul ni / mtha' bzhi mi nub g.yung drung rgyal po 'byung / zhes pa'i lung gis zin pa'i dam pa gang des brag dmar ke ru nas bya ra ma dgu la sogs bon sde mi 'dra ba bco brgyad thon no /

The Srid-rgyud says: There will be one called mTha'-bzhi Mi-nub gYung-drung rGyal-po, The manifestation of Tshe-dbang Rig-'dzin. Texts were rediscovered in Brag-dmar ke-ru by mTha'-bzhi Mi-nub gYung-drung rGyal-po whose coming had been foreseen in the prophetic book. There were eighteen different texts, the Bya-ra ma-dgu, etc.
(brag dkar yang dbon)
(The discovery in Brag-dkar yang-dben)

yang srid rgyud las / gyer mi nyi 'od kyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i bu / ngu za nyi ma'i mtshan can 'byung / zhes pa de nyid kyis brag dkar yang dbon nas bskal pa bzang po'i mdo sde dang / lde mig skor tshom gsum gsum ste drug thon par bshad do /

The Srid-rgyud says: There will be one called Ngu-za Nyi-ma, Who is blessed by Gyer-mi Nyi-'od. Texts were rediscovered in Brag-dkar yang-dben by Ngu-za Nyi-ma. They were the bsKal-pa bzang-po mdo-sde and the lDe-mig skor-tshom.
('dzing kha rag ldong phrom)
(The discovery in 'Dzing kha-rag ldong-phrom)

yang srid rgyud las / dran pa'i zhal nas kho bo'i byin gyis brlabs pa'i bu / a thang yon rin bya bas / 'dzing kha rag ldong phrom gyi dngos grub len / zhes pas / zhang zhung sgra bla ma'i sgrub skor gsum thon no /

Dran-pa Nam-mkha' states in the Srid-rgyud: A man called A-thang Yon-rin whom I have blessed will receive the gift in 'Dzing kha-rag ldom-phrom. A-thang yon-rin found the three cycles of Zhang-zhung sgra-bla-ma in 'Dzing kha-rag ldong-phrom.
(rong bon g.yung drung 'od zer)
(The visual letters of Rong-bon gYung-drung 'Od-zer)
yang rong bon g.yung drung 'od zer la 'od kyi yi ger babs pa'i stag la spu gri dkar dmar nag gsum dbal chen gsang ba thugs rgyud kyi skor dang / btsan bdud keng gsum gyi skor rnams yod do /

Letters of light appeared before Rong-bon gYung-drung 'Od-zer. (They spelt out) the sTag-la spu-gri dkar-nag dmar-gsum, the cycle of the dBal-chen gsang-ba thugs-rgyud and the cycle of bTsan bDud Keng gsum.
(stag za rin chen mtsho mo)
(The oral tradition of sTag-za Rin-chen mTsho-mo)

yang stag za rin chen mtsho mo'i snyan brgyud ma rgyud kyi rgyud gsum / bla ma yi dam mkha' 'gro'i skor / ma rgyud las tshogs gter phreng / tshe dbang skor / bka' srung yum sras sde lnga / 'pho ba'i man ngag / dug bsal la sogs yod do /

Texts were passed on orally to sTag-za Rin-chen mTsho-mo. They were the three rGyud of Ma-rgyud, the cycle of the Bla-ma yi-dam mkha'-'gro, the Ma-rgyud las-tshogs gter-phreng, the Tshe-dbang cycle, the bKa'-srung yum-sras sde-lnga, the 'Pho-ba'i man-ngag, the Dug-bsal, etc.
(dbu za rin chen gsal)
(The oral tradition of dBu-za Rin-chen-gsal)
yang dbu za rin chen gsal la snyan du brgyud pa'i gcod kyi gdams pa sogs mang du yod do /
Texts were passed on orally to dBu-za Rin-chen-gsal. They were the gCod-gyi gdams-pa, etc.
(gab tog brag ri)
(The discovery in Gab-tog Brag-ri)

yang gu ru yon tan seng ges rgya rong gab tog brag ri nas drangs pa'i char 'beb g.yu mtsho mer ba'i skor / tso min char 'beb dngul g.yu ma'i skor / ma 'ong lung bstan sde drug / gter srung srid rgyal skor rnams yod do /

Texts were rediscovered in Gab-tog brag-ri in rGya-rong by Gu-ru Yon-tan Seng-ge. They were the cycles of the Char-'beb gyu-mtsho mer-ba, the cycle of the Tso-mi char-'beb dngul-g.yu-ma, the Ma-'ong lung-bstan sde-drug, and the gTer-srung Srid-rgyal cycle.
(gling gshen bsod nams blo gros)
(The oral tradition of Gling-gshen bSod-nams Blo-gros)
gling gshen bsod nams blo gros la snyan du brgyud pa'i ma gsum gcod dang sgrub phran 'ga' zhig yod do /
Texts were passed on orally to Gling-gshen bSod-nams Blo-gros. They were the Ma-gsum-gcod and some other small rites.
(kha ba dkar po)
(The discovery in Kha-ba dkar-po)
khyung po bkra shis rgyal mtshan gyis tsha rong kha ba dkar po nas drangs pa'i dran pa a dkar dgongs 'dus sogs bai ro'i bka' 'ga' yod do /
Texts were rediscovered in Kha-ba dkar-po in Tsha-ba-rong by Khyung-po bKra-shis rGyal-mtshan. They were the Dran-pa A-dkar dgongs-'dus, etc., by Vairocana.
(tshe spungs gsang ba)
(The discovery in Tshe-spungs gsang-ba)
g.yung drung tshe dbang rgyal pos tshe spungs gsang ba'i gnas nas drangs pa'i rdzogs chen gser gyi yang zhun gyi skor dang srid rgyal gyi skor la sogs yod do /
Texts were rediscovered in Tshe-spungs gsang-ba by gYung-drung Tshe-dbang rGyal-po: the cycle of the rDzogs-chen gser-gyi yang-zhun, the Srid-rgyal cycle, etc.
(shel zhig g.yung drung rgyal po)
(The oral tradition of Shel-zhig gYung-drung rGyal-po)
yang shel zhig g.yung drung rgyal po la snyan du brgyud pa'i bon sde la
Texts were passed on orally to Shel-zhig gYung-drung rGyal-po.

zhi khro dgongs 'dus / smra seng gi skor / khro bo dzwa dmar 'khyil pa / yab sras dril sgrub / rkyang sgrub / dran pa gsang sgrub / tshe dbang yang zhun skor / drag gcod gnam lcags thog mda' / tshe dbang thugs sgrub / rol pa bam chen rgyud gzhung skor / rdzogs chen gser zhun / bla ma zhi drag gi sgrub skor / ge khod gsang this / nyams yig che chung / sngags 'bum / a dkar dgongs 'dus sogs mang du yod do /
(sprul sku sangs rgyas gling pa)
(The oral tradition and discovery of sPrul-sku Sangs-rgyas Gling-pa)
yang sprul sku sangs rgyas gling pa la bka' gter gnyis las /
sPrul-sku Sangs-rgyas Gling-pa was responsible for the oral tradition and discoveries of texts and other items.

dang po snyan brgyud bka' ma'i skor la / gnas rten bcu drug gi cho ga / gsang mchog rol pa / dran pa bdud dpung 'dul / tshe dbang g.yung drung gur khang / thugs rje kun grol / stag la'i skor / rdzong 'phrang le'u gsum pa rnams yod / gnyis pa gter la / tshe sgrub rdo rje go khrab / bla ma dgongs 'dus / bka' thang kun snang gsal sgron glegs bam bzhi / che mchog dran pa drag po / tshe dbang ga'u dmar nag / don zhags skor / 'od dpag med la sogs mang ngo /
rdzas gter la mthing sku pad+ma 'od 'bar / bram ze'i thod pa / mkha' 'gro kun sgrol sku tshab / tshe dbang phyag sil / bai ro'i phyag tshwa sogs gter nas thon no /
(rig 'dzin kun grol grags pa)
(The discovery of Rig-'dzin Kun-grol Grags-pa)

rig 'dzin kun grol grags pa la gter ni / ma mo rbod gtong snang srid zil gnon gyi sgrub skor dang / rtsa rlung mkha' 'gro gsang mdzod la sogs pa dang / dgongs gter gyi phyogs su gtogs pa zhi khro dgongs 'dus / mkha' 'gro dgongs 'dus / bla ma dgongs 'dus / dmar khrid dgongs 'dus sogs dang / gzhan yang dag snang gi skor dang khrid la sogs shin tu mang ngo /

The textual discovery of Rig-'dzin Kun-grol Grags-pa consisted of the Ma-mo rbod-gtong snang-srid zil-gnon-gyi sgrub-skor, the rTsa-rlung mkha'-gro gsang-mdzod, etc. His mental textual treasure consisted of the Zhi-khro dgongs-'dus, the mKha'-'gro dgongs-'dus, the Bla-ma dgongs-'dus, the dMar-khrid dgongs-'dus, etc. Furthermore, he composed many preceptive books and guides, etc.

skabs 'dir gzhan sde kha cig gis / blo ldan snying po / mi shigs rdo rje / sangs rgyas gling pa / kun grol grags pa rnam bzhi la phyis byon sprul sku rnam bzhi'i lugs zhes gter gsar gyi grangs su brtsi ste / 'di rnams o rgyan chen po dang rje 'bangs rnams kyis sems can 'dul thabs bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam rol chos la bon ming btags pas / lta spyod bka' rtags kyi phyag rgya bzhi po dang mi 'gal bar thar lam yod nges can du snang / zhes bshad pa ni ma brtags pa'i tshig tu 'dug pas na mi 'thad do /

Now some of «The Others» accept the teachings of the Four Recent Manifestations, viz. Blo-ldan sNying-po, Mi-shig rDo-rje, Sangs-rgyas Gling-pa, and Kun-grol Grags-pa as Late Textual Treasures claiming that the name of Bon has been given to unimaginable Buddhist teachings intended for the training of sentient beings by manifestations of the great O-rgyan and his disciples, since not being contrary to the «Four Perceptive Seals» of View and Conduct, they appear to constitute a sure path to enlightenment. These assertions are unacceptable since they are ill-considered.

de'ang bon dang bon nyid kyi ngo bo stong pa nyid spros pa'i mtha' thams cad dang bral bar gnas te / mdzod las / bon dang bon nyid thams cad ni / stong pa dam pa'i mchog ldan pas / bla med 'bras bu 'thob pa ni / skye dang skye med gdod nas dag / kun kyang stong pa'i mtshan nyid 'dzin / zhes pas so / de lta bu'i bon nyid kyi gnas lugs la bon dang chos zhes pa ris su chad pa med nges pa la / tshig bla dwags su bon nyid dang chos nyid ces zer ba ni btags ming ste don dam par smra bsam brjod 'das so / kun rdzob tu rang bzhin tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs su gnas pa ste / de'i byed las sems can thams cad gnas skabs dang mthar thug gi 'jigs pa dang 'jigs pa chen po las skyob par byed de / mdo las / bon ni mi g.yo skyob pa'i sgra / ces so /

The nature of phenomena is the formless Void. The mDzod says: As all phenomena Are ultimately the Void; Full attainment From its origin is immune to birth or rebirth; All phenomena have the character of Voidness. When Bon is understood as Voidness there is nothing to choose between Bon and Chos. The definition Bon or Chos is only a matter of names. In reality they are without substance. They are just an everyday form of words and letters the purpose of which is to protect all sentient beings from anxiety both ephemeral and perpetual. The mDo says: By definition Bon means unfailing protection.
des na chos kyi ming bon ma yin te / bon dang chos gnyis ka la brjod bya'i don dang / rjod byed kyi tshig gnyis su 'byung ba las / bon zhes pa ni ming dang tshig gi bla dwags tsam ste /
Therefore, Chos is not given the name of Bon. Chos and Bon each concern different subjects and have different words to express them. Bon itself is a word which defines.
mdzod las / ming gi 'du byed khams gsum 'khor / nyid la bla dwags mtshan nyid 'dzin zhes dang /
The mDzod says: The notion of name in the three worlds, Implies self-definition.
tshig gi 'du byed khams gsum 'khor / khyad kyi bla dwags mtshan nyid 'dzin / zhes pas /
The notion of word in the three worlds, Implies discrimination.

ming tshig ni rjod byed kyi ngag tsam ste / de'i brjod bya ni bon rang lugs la bslab pa gsum dang / bden pa gnyis sogs yin te / chos btags ming de ni ma yin no / gal te chos btags ming de'i ming bon yin na / rjod byed tshig tsam de / brjod bya'i don du 'gyur la / de ltar na rjod byed tshig tsam gyi ngor / brjod bya'i don yang dag pa mi gnas te / dper na lha'i sbyin zhes pa'i ming tsam gyi ngor / lha'i sbyin yang dag pa med pa bzhin no / der ma zad sprul sku rnam bzhi'i bka' rnams bka' rtags kyi phyag rgya bzhi dang mi 'gal zhing thar lam yod nges can yin zhes pa ltar na / gter rnying bon rnying ma thams cad de ltar ma yin pa 'gyur te / de ni bon gyi sgo tsam yang mthong ma myong ba'i phug rgyus bshad stang byed pa dang mtshungs te / phyogs zhen che ba'i gtam du zad do / sprul sku rnam bzhi'i bon gsar ma rnams o rgyan rje 'bang rnams kyi bka' kho nar 'dod pa'ang 'gal te / o rgyan chen po yan gyi bon gyi sku gsum rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nas rim gyis brgyud pa'i bka' yin pa'i phyir /

Thus name and word are expressive speech forms. The subjects expressed in our system of Bon are the Triple Doctrine, the Two Truths, etc., i.e. not those of the Chos of which Bon is alleged to be the false name. If Chos had merely been called Bon then it would only be (a mass of) words devoid of real significance. For instance, if a man is called lHa-sbyin, it does not mean that lHa-sbyin is necessarily in him. If, according to the assertion of «The Others», the teachings of the Four Manifestations, not being contrary to the «Four Preceptive Seals», appear to constitute a sure path of enlightenment, then the earlier Bon textual treasures and earlier Bon doctrine would not teach anything of the path of enlightenment. It is as if someone were expounding the history of Bon without ever having seen any Bon texts. It is just tendentious talk. It would be contradictory to suppose that the late Bon of the Four Manifestations was nothing but the teaching of O-rgyan and his followers, for it has been transmitted from the Enlightened One perfected in the three Bodies of Bon.

bon gsar rnying gnyis la zab zhan cung zad kyang med pa'o / de'i phyir bon zhes pa dang chos zhes pa ni ming gi tha snyad tsam ste ngo bo nyid la 'gyur ba med do / de lta na'ang sangs rgyas rnams kyis sems can gyi don mdzad pa la thabs thugs ma 'gags pa'i rnam rol bon dang chos gnyis su snang ba yang gnas skabs tsam gyi thabs mkhas kyi mdzad pa de ltar snang ba'o / des na bon dang chos gnyis kyang kun rdzob tsam du bon gyi sku gsum nas rim gyis brgyud pa'i tshig dang yi ge la bon zhes dang / chos kyi sku gsum nas rim gyis brgyud pa'i tshig dang / yi ge la chos zhes pa'i ming btags nas rang rang gi grub mtha' bzung ste don gnyis lhun gyis grub par byed pa yin no / des na bon gsar ma zhes pa yang bon gyi sku gsum nas rim gyis brgyud pa'i phyir bon yin la chos ma yin no / gal te dkyil 'khor yang gzhan la de nyid chos kyi sku gsum nas chos lugs ltar rim gyis brgyud par 'dug na chos zhes pa'i tha snyad kyang rung zhing bkag kyang mi bkag go / de dag zhar byung du smos pa'o /

There is no difference in profundity between the earlier and late Bon. Bon or Chos are just appellations, in reality they are changeless. To put it concisely, Enlightened Ones in their unceasing efforts and compassion as they labour for the welfare of sentient beings have made manifest temporary revelations of both Bon and Chos. Therefore, the words and letters that for everyday purposes come down from the Three Bodies of Bon are called Bon, the words and letters that come down from the Three Bodies of Chos are called Chos. We follow different doctrines to achieve different purposes. Therefore, since the late Bon was transmitted from the Three Bodies of Bon it is called Bon, not Chos. If there are other teachings which come down from the Three Bodies of Chos (even if they are mingled with Bon), they may rightly be called Chos and I do not object to their being called Chos.
(dang ra khyung rdzong)
(The discovery in Dang-ra khyung-rdzong)

gzhan yang khro bo lha rgod thog pa snang srid zil gnon gyi sgrub pa cha lag dang bcas pa dran pa nam mkhas bstan pa dar nub dus su dang ra khyung rdzong du gter du sbas te gter srung la bcol ba phyis su sku mdun bsod nams blo gros la mkha' 'gros lung bstan nas gter zhal phyes te / slar lcags mo yos lo zla ba dang po'i tshes la mkha' 'gro'i bka' rgya yol nas shog ser yig phreng sum cu tham pa slar bod shog la phab ste / bka' bab thugs kyi slob ma rkam rigs g.yung drung nyi rgyal la brgyud de dar ro /

Dran-pa (Nam-mkha') concealed the Khro-bo lha-rgod thod-pa snang-srid zil-gnon-gyi sgrub-pa and its ancillary text in Dang-ra khyung-rdzong during the suppression of the Doctrine and entrusted them to a Textual Guardian. Later sKu-mdun bSod-nams Blo-gros rediscovered them after receiving prophetic instructions from a mystic goddess. In the first month of the Iron-female hare year when the period of secrecy imposed by the mystic goddess was over he wrote down on Tibetan paper the manuscript of the texts which was thirty lines long. Then he transmitted them to his spiritual son sKam-rigs gYung-drung Nyi-rgyal.
gzhan yang dam pa de'i snyan brgyud du tri su mun sel sgron ma'i gzhung la sogs yod pa rnams snang ston zla ba rgyal mtshan la brgyud de dar ro /
Texts were also passed on orally to him. They were the Du-tri-su mun-sel sgron-ma'i gzhung, etc., and he transmitted them to sNang-ston Zla-ba rGyal-mtshan.
(dbal 'bar stag slag can)
(The discovery of dBal-bar sTag-slag-can)
yang dbal 'bar stag slag can gyis gter nas thon pa'i dbal phur gyi rgyud dang sgrub pa cha lag dang / bka' skyongs dril nag gi skor la sogs mang du yod par grags so /
Texts were apparently rediscovered by dBal-'bar sTag-slag-can. They were the rGyud of dBal-phur and its rites, the bKa'-skyong drel-nag cycle, etc.
(bde chen gling pa)
(The discovery of bDe-chen Gling-pa)

yang kho bo'i bla ma bde chen gling pa'am phyi nang gsang ba'i mtshan gyi snyan pas mdo khams stod smad kun tu khyab pa de nyid ma 'ongs lung gi zin tshul dang gter gyi dngos grub brnyes pa lung gis bstan pa ni /

The coming of my lama, bDe-chen Gling-pa, the fame of whose outer, inner, and secret names pervaded the upper and lower lands of Amdo and Khams, was foreseen in a prophetic book as was also the receipt of the gift of textual treasure.

gshin rje gshed nag gi rgyud las / de nas mi rabs bdun tsam song ba'i mtshams / slob dpon chen pos byin gyis brlabs pa'i bu / gshed bzhi lo pa mi 'gyur mtshan can 'byung / mkha' spyod o rgyan yul du dngos grub len / gsang ba'i bon sgo bcu gsum dag la dbang / khyad par sngon gyi rtsa 'gag song ba rnams / o rgyan me tog spungs mdzes dgon pa ru / rig 'dzin rnams dang mjal te dngos grub len / chad pa'i bon rnams ma lus spel nas kyang / bstan pa mtha' ru rgyas par byed par 'gyur /

The gShin-rje gshed-nag-gi rgyud says: Then when seven generations have passed, A son blessed by the great teacher will arise, In one of the four evil years with the name of Mi-'gyur. In Uḍḍiyāna and the Celestial Sphere he will receive gifts. He will be the Master of the thirteen secret Bon, In particular, (of the teachings) which completely disappeared. In the hermitage of Me-tog spungs-mdzes in Uḍḍiyāna, He will meet the knowledge-holders and receive gifts from them. By diffusing all the Bon which had disappeared, He will spread the Doctrine far and wide.

zhes pa'i lung mthun gyi gter ston dam pa de nyid dgung lo bcu gsum lor o rgyan gsang chen mkha' spyod dur khrod du phebs te bka' gter chen po bcu gsum gyi bka' bab par phyi nang gsang ba yang gsang bzhi / de re re la yang rgyud lung man ngag ste bcu gnyis / gnyis ka ma yin pa dang bcu gsum du yod pas /

The holy text-discoverer, whose coming was mentioned in the prophetic book, went to the cemetery of Uḍḍiyāna, the great secret «Celestial Sphere», at the age of thirteen and was commissioned to discover the thirteen great textual treasures belonging to the classes of exoteric, esoteric, secret, and ultimate secret Bon, a rGyud, a Lung, and a Man-ngag in each class making up twelve of the texts, the thirteenth belonging to none of these types.
dang po phyi mdo la / kun bzang nam mkha'i rgyal po rgyud kyi mdo /

mthar phyin dga' ba dge ldan lung gi mdo / dus kyi 'khor lo 'byung ba man ngag gi mdo dang gsum / de dag gi cha lag dang bcas pa dang / gnyis pa nang sngags la / bde gshegs bka' brgyad gsang 'dus rgyud kyi sngags / dbal phur thugs kyi gzer bu lung gi sngags / bde gshegs dgongs 'dus thugs sgrub man ngag gi sngags dang gsum / de dag la yang cha lag dang bcas pa dang / gsum pa gsang ba la / dbyings chen zab mo bstan pa rgyud kyi sde / mkha' 'gro shes rab gsang ba ba ga'i rgyud dang / mkha' gsang gab pa sgron me lung gi sde / rig 'dzin thabs kyi skor la sde tshan gsum dang / srid pa klong gi man ngag rgyud kyi skor / ma mo yangs snying 'dus pa rbod gtong gi skor dang / dug mtsho khol ma 'jig byed gshin rje'i skor dang / gser 'od nor bu mchog rgyal thabs kyi skor dang gsum / de dag gi cha lag zhib rgyas rnams dang / bon gyi yang snying bla med rdzogs pa chen po phyi nang gnyis su bstan pa dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa la rdzong 'phrang gsum bcas yod do /
gzhan yang snyan brgyud kyi skor yang mang ngo / bka' gsang zab mo de rnams bka' bab bzhi la sogs las can rnams la brgyud de dar ro /
Many texts were also passed on orally to bDe-chen Gling-pa. He transmitted all his profound teachings to his four Commissioned Ones.
yang gter ston gsang sngags gling pa'i bka' gter skor ni /
(The discovery of gSang-sngags Gling-pa)
kha byang las / 'gro don gnas chen bzhi la gter sgo 'byed / nyi shu rtsa lnga'i zab gter dngos grub 'byung / zhes pas / de dag phyi nang gsang ba gsum thun mong ma yin pa'i sde dang bzhi'i /

The Kha-byang says: There will be one who, for the welfare of sentient beings, will open the door of textual treasure in four great places, Twenty-five gifts of profound textual treasures will be bestowed on him. Texts were rediscovered by the text-discoverer gSang-sngags Gling-pa belonging to the classes of exoteric, esoteric, secret, and extraordinary texts.

dang po phyi la / char 'beb bdud rtsi rgya mtsho / klu chog sogs dang / nang la gsang sngags la me ri'i dzwa sgrub this 'dur bcas / stag la'i sgrub pa srid 'dur dang bcas pa / yang stag la gri 'dur can / gshin rje gshed nag zhi drag gnyis / drel dmar sgrub skor / drel nag sgrub skor / gtad sprug man ngag bcas / spyi spungs gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud / lung rgyud sogs dang / tshe sgrub skor la / tshe sgrub yang snying 'dus pa / rtsa gsum tshe sgrub / pu ru la brten pa'i tshe sgrub dang / gsang ba la gu ru zhi drag seng gsum rdzogs rim gyi khrid skor dang bcas pa / sku gsum phur sgrub rim gnyis kyi nyams len rdzogs chen dang bcas pa /

thugs rje kun sgrol gyi gcod gdams skor / smra seng sgrub pa rnams dang / thun min 'chi med tshe dbang rig 'dzin chen po'i rnam thar glegs bam bzhi / yang gyer chen dran pa nam mkha'i rnam thar glegs bam brgyad sogs mang ngo /
(bde chen dbang mo)
(The discovery of bDe-chen dBang-mo)
yang mkha' 'gro bde chen dbang gi sgron ma'i bon gter la / mkha' 'gro'i bka' thang glegs bam gcig / snying thig bcu gsum sogs yod do /
Texts were rediscovered by mKha'-'gro bDe-chen dBang-gi sGron-ma. They were the mKha'-gro'i bka'-thang in one volume and the sNying-thig bcu-gsum, etc.

gzhan yang 'dir ma zin pa du ma zhig da lta'i yul mtha' dbus rnams su yod mod kyi re zhig dkar chag ma 'dzom pas 'bri bar ma nus la / 'dir smos pa rnams ni skyes bu dam pa thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i shes rab kyi spyan ras yangs pa rnams kyis bstan 'byung du bkod pa dang tshad mar grags pa rnams las thos thos dang du blangs pa ni med de / ji skad du / gter min gter 'dra gter rdzun lung pa gang / shes med grub mtha' brtsod cing bud med dad / ces gsungs pa bzhin bdud kyis bstan pa la tho brtsam pa'i phyir gter ston du brdzu ba dang / sems can gyi las dbang bsam mi khyab pas zog po gter rdzus lo 'dod sgrub pa'ang rang gzhan gyi sde kun la shin tu mang bas bstan pa'i gshed du che ba'i phyir ro /

Many textual treasures and oral traditions are not included here though they exist in the central and borderlands, but since no catalogue of them was available to me I have not been able to record them. Those of which I have made mention are taken from the histories written by holy persons whose discernment in the common and extraordinary fields is very extensive and who are known as infallible authorities. I have not just accepted whatever I (saw) or heard. So it is said: The country is full of false, lying, and specious textual treasures, And such as have no knowledge of doctrine and are fond of arguing and women. Thus there are not only demons who pretend to be text-discoverers in order to undermine the Doctrine, but, because of the ineffable karmic forces which govern sentient beings, false textual treasures, which bring their ill-wishing to fruition, are numerous among ourselves and «The Others». They do great evil to the Doctrine.

gzhan yang bru zhu spa rme'u me gnyos 'gro mgon sga ston skyabs ston mnyam med chen po sogs mkhas grub gnyis ldan gyi lung zin dam pa rnams kyi mdzad byang bka' brten du bsdu bar 'os pa ches mang yang re zhig yi ges 'jigs so /

Finally, the works by the scholar-ascetics of Bru, Zhu, sPa, and rMe'u; (as well as) the works of Me, gNyos, 'Gro-mgon, sGa-ston, sKyabs-ston, mNyam-med Chen-po, etc.—whose comings were foretold in prophetic books—are numerous and well deserve to be included in the category of bKa'-brten, but fearing to be prolix (I have not included them here).
gsum pa [de dag lho byang dbus dang khams gter gter gsar gyi khongs su bsdu ba] la gsum /
III. Their classification into Southern, Northern, Central, Khams, and recent textual treasures
de dag lho byang dbus gter sogs lngar bsdu ba / bka' dang bka' brten gnyis su bsdu ba / zhar byung phyis rgyal bstan ji tsam gnas pa bstan pa'o /

a. The textual treasures classified into five (divisions), viz. Southern, Northern, Central, etc. b. The textual treasures reduced to bKa' («Original Words») and bKa'-brten (Dependent on the «Original Words») c. Digression concerning the duration of the Doctrine into the future
dang po [de dag lho byang dbus gter sogs lngar bsdu ba] la lnga /
a. The textual treasures classified into five (divisions),
byang gter / lho gter / dbus gter / khams gter / gter gsar ro /
viz. Southern, Northern, Central, etc.
dang po [byang gter]
i. [Northern]

byang gter dngos ni lho bal gyi a tsa ra gsum gyi bka' gter rnams yin la / der gtogs pa ni nga 'phrang lha'i dbang phyug / mar pa 'phan bzang / khro 'brug / chos kyi gze ston spu gu'i gter bon skor dang / go lde 'phags pas g.yung drung seng mchong brag nas bton pa sogs so /

The principal texts of the Northern Textual Treasures are those of the three ācāryas of Nepal. Other textual treasures which come into this category are those rediscovered by 'Phrang-lha'i dBang-phyug, Mar-pa 'Phen-bzang, Khro-'brug, gZe-ston sPu-gu rGyal-mtshan, and that rediscovered in gYung-drung Seng-mchong-brag by Go-lde 'Phags-pa.
gnyis pa [lho gter]
ii. [Southern]
lho gter gyi gtso bo ni gshen klu dgas bton pa'i bon sde rnams yin la /
The principal texts of the Southern Textual Treasures are those rediscovered by gShen Klu-dga'.

der gtogs pa ni spa gro ma / shel brag ma / lho brag khom mthing ma sogs dang / gzhan yang sa ston 'brug lha / ra ljags kyi bon skor / ba co sgom chen / 'jing ston mu lto ba / bu mtsho srid pa'i rgyal po / mtshe mi gsas khyung / khu 'dzin 'jing nag sogs kyis bton pa'i bon sde rnams so /

Other textual treasures which come into this category are sPa-gro-ma, Shel-brag-ma, lHo-brag khom-mthing-ma, etc., also those rediscovered by Sa-ston 'Brug-lha, Ra-ljags, Bal-zho sGom-chen, 'Jing-ston Mu-lto-ba, Bu-mtsho Srid-pa'i rGyal-po, mTsho-bon Khyung-gsas, Khu-'dzin 'Jing-nag, etc.
gsum pa [dbus gter]
iii. [Central]

dbus gter la yer rdzong ma dang / bsam yas skor khang ma ni a tsa ra gsum gyis bton pa rnams te gong du byang gter du bshad la / bsam yas ca ti ma / drang nga ma'i skor / bsam yas ka khol ma / ra ston 'bum rjes thon pa rnams so /

The Central Textual Treasures are Yer-rdzong-ma— bSam-yas skor-khang-ma rediscovered by the three ācāryas belonging to the Northern Textual Treasures which I mentioned earlier—bSam-yas ca-ti-ma, Drang-nga-ma, bSam-yas ka-khol-ma, and those rediscovered by Ra-ston 'Bum-rje.
bzhi pa [khams gter]
iv. [Khams]

khams gter la snga ba gu ru ban chung / khod po blo gros / sprul sku spyang 'phags / dbang ldan gshen gsas / bra bo sgom nag / kyu ra rnal 'byor / rko bo gter ston / se gnyan zhig po / tshil po gter ston / 'tsho sprul / u go g.yung drung 'bum / pho chen nam mkha' 'od zer sogs kyis bton pa sogs mang ngo /

The Textual Treasures of Khams are those rediscovered by Gu-ru Ban-chung, Khod-po Blo-gros, sPrul-sku sKyang-'phags, dBang-ldan gShen-gsas, Bra-bo sGom-nyag, Kyu-ra rNal-'byor, rKo-bo gTer-ston, Se-gnyan Zhig-po, Tshil-po gTer-ston, 'Tshol-sprul, U-go gYung-drung-'bum, Pho-chen Nam-mkha' 'Od-zer, etc.
lnga pa [gter gsar]
v. [Recent]
gter gsar la / rma ston srol 'dzin / rma lcam me / rma sher seng / sba bon khyung thog / gu ru rnon rtse / dpon gsas khyung rgod /
The Recent Textual Treasures are those rediscovered by rMa-ston Srol-'dzin, rMa lCam-me, rMa Sher-seng, sPa-bon Khyung-thog, Gu-ru rNon-rtse, dPon-gsas Khyung-rgod-rtsal,

g.yung drung gling pa sogs kyi bka' gter sogs la snga rabs pa dag gis gter gsar du bzhag pa ding sang ni de dag gter gsar du mi btub kyang sa bcad 'di'i khongs su bsdus te / ding sang ni shel zhig g.yung drung rgyal po man chad gter gsar du grags so /

gYung-drung Gling-pa, etc. Since those texts were called recent textual treasure by contemporary scholars, I put them into this section though they are no longer recent. Nowadays the texts rediscovered by Shel-zhig gYung-drung rGyal-po onwards are known as the Recent Textual Treasures.
gnyis pa bka' dang bka' brten du bsdu tshul la gsum /
b. The classification into bKa' and bKa'-brten.
bka' dang / bka' brten / gnyis ka'i don no /
dang po [bka'] ni /
i. «Original Words»

bka'i dbye sgo bcu gsum la sogs mang yang re zhig sde tshan dbye 'byed sla zhing thams cad 'thus pa'i dbang du byas na / bka' phun sum tshogs pa mdo yi sde / rnam dag rgyas pa 'bum gyi sde / zab lam gsang sngags kyi sde / bla med sems phyogs kyi sde dang bzhir phyes na legs par mngon to / mdo 'dus pa las kyang / nga ni mya ngan 'das 'og tu / mdo 'bum rgyud mdzod bzhir phyes la / 'khor rnams bka' yi bsdu ba gyis / zhes so /

There are as many as thirteen ways of classifying the bKa', but for the sake of simplification and conciseness, it will be convenient if we classify it into the perfect mDo, the pure and extensive 'Bum, the profound path of rGyud and the exalted Mental Teaching. The mDo-'dus also says: After I die, Attendants! into four divisions: mDo, 'Bum, rGyud, and mDzod; Carry out the classification of bKa'.
gnyis pa [bka' brten] ni /
ii. Dependent on the «Original Words»
bka' brten la mdor bsdu na bka' rgyud so so'i dgongs pa 'grel pa'i bka' brten dang / bka' spyi yi dgongs pa 'grel pa'i bka' brten dang gnyis yod do /

There are, in short, two ways of classifying the bKa'-brten: the bKa'-brten which explains the import of individual canonical texts and the bKa'-brten which explains the import of canonical texts in general.
gsum pa gnyis ka'i don ni /
iii. Both

bka' dang bka' brten gyi 'gyur ji ltar sgrigs tshul yin te mkhan chen nyi ma bstan 'dzin gyis bka' dang bka' brten gyi rnam bshad nyi 'od rab gsal dang / sde tshan sgrig tshul gyi dkar chag gshen bstan pad+mo'i nyi 'od ces pa'i le'u tshan gnyis yod pa la / lung rigs tshad ma'i gnod pa med cing mkhas pa'i legs bshad du snang bas de la yid rton par rigs so /

Concerning the systematic classification of (both) bKa' and bKa'-brten there are two works by the great abbot Nyi-ma bsTan-'dzin: the bKa'-dang bKa'-brten-gyi rnam-bshad nyi-'od rab-gsal and the sDe-tshan sgrigs-tshul-gyi dkar-chags gshen-bstan pad-mo'i nyi-od. Since they are proof against authoritative criticism and logical objections and are the work of such (a great) scholar, they are fit to be trusted by us.
